title: LF Diamond+ adc smurf to duo with on an alt account.
body:
Status: **ONLINE** as of 2:55pm AEST
------------------------------------------------------------------
I main Support, I have 3 years experience playing Support, 4 years playing League.

LF an ADC who has an **unranked level 30** that is interested in duoing with me on my fresh level 30 to rank up to plat+

Looking for the ADC to be at least Diamond 5 experienced, anything higher is preferred.
Must be able to play **at least** 10 games over sat/sun between 9am-12pm AEST

Pref. if you main the following adcs:
------------------------------------------------------------------
{{champion:42}} Corki
{{champion:222}} Jinx
{{champion:236}} Lucian
------------------------------------------------------------------
Thanks guys, add me on client, or discuss here. 
{{item:3060}}

replies.body: that moment when a bronze player wants elo boosts from diamond :)

> [{quoted}](name=Justify,realm=OCE,application-id=mR0UmRrp,discussion-id=T7ko2Alu,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2015-01-14T04:45:35.971+0000)
>
> that moment when a bronze player wants elo boosts from diamond :)

grats on **gold 5** with **437 wins**, that must of been really hard for someone with your mental capacity.

So you believe ones intelligence can be determined by league ranking and wins/losses? 
For the sake of your children (if any lady is dumb enough to make a life with you) I pray that you abstain from marijuana and your brain cells no longer deteriorate.

Best of wishes in future years, because once your youth comes to a close things won't be bright and sparkly :D
Just let it sink in though, 437 wins Gold 5.

You put such emphasis on ones ability to perform on a **game**,  which is designed to have** fun**.
And believe that ingame skill amounts to something in the real world. 

In addition, you are oblivious to the fact that everyone has a starting point.

I didn't at any point say that in game ability equates in the real world.

Also your account has 1572 hours play time, which is 65.5 days, that's enough time to hit plat+ easily if you've a functional brain that can pick up patterns.

show me your source, also it's funny how uneducated plebs like you keep insisting that x hours spent on LoL = functioning or not functioning brain. 

I suppose you haven't done any research.... there are actually a lot of players which have the same time spent as me or more and are in a lower division than me, also gbay did a video awhile ago about how his friend stayed bronze 5 while he reached challenger, and both of them played for the same amount of time. I suppose you also think that his bronze 5 friend didn't have a functioning brain? Oh and they both went to college together! your whole theory is flawed, your parents were too retar**de**d to abort you

You've played over 2500 varied league of legends games, which means you've had a lot of experience, gold 5 is where people have the bare basic understand of the game, you don't even need to try to be a gold player, you need to hit 60% of your CS and know how to use your abilities loosely, assuming you, a human being, learn from mistakes, which clearly you haven't since you are gold 5 after 1572 hours, you should be much higher rating based on the fact you should be almost unconsciously improving with that many hours devoted to the game, yet clearly, you are incapable.

source: http://www.loltimeplayed.com/timeplayed.php?region=oce&summoner=justify

http://www.loltimeplayed.com/timeplayed.php?region=oce&summoner=acinicus

okay so this guy has 72 days played and is bronze 5, I suppose he is mentally ret**ar**ded?

Actually a lot of players have the same amount of time played as more or more, and are of a lower ranking, you can gtfo with the ideology that x time played = x rank = not mentally inefficient.

Because you were able to reach x elo with x amount of time played you think you are better than everyone else, when really it just takes a lot of dedication and accepting that you're bad. If you didn't realise a large percentage of players suffer from the Dunning Kruger effect, in which they think they are better than everyone but really are of the same skill level. 

If you weren't so retar**ded** maybe you could take this into consideration ;) and also realise this is just a game where people are trying to have fun.
"when really it just takes dedication and learning from mistakes." exactly, you've given me fuel for my fire, elo is based on experience, further proving that you're incapable.
done arguing with a dogmatic ba**st**ard who will amount to nothing
:) all I read was "you are correct, I'm a coward who will run now".
go back to school and work on your reading comprehension, what a shame your parents are both degenerates which didn't have the sense not to have kids or to abort you.
lol doesn't change the fact that you are ret**ar**ded, I mean you actually believe that if someone can't reach a division in a set amount of time they mentally inefficient... like wow...
Resorting to irrelevant banter I see, I've graduated school, good to see you can't stay focused on a particular subject, mummy might want to get you tested for ADHD with that attention span.
